Class HangmanTest

java.lang.Object
HangmanTest
class HangmanTest extends Object
These are the minimum tests that should pass to confirm this code is working.
The test will create a file, testWords.txt, run several tests against that file, and then remove the file. TODO: setup BAD files to test... <-- sounds like a wonderful homework assignment.
Since:
2 - August - 2023

  • Method Details

    • makeTheFile

      @BeforeAll static void makeTheFile()
      BeforeAll will run ONCE at the start of the test.

    • removeFile

      @AfterAll static void removeFile()
      @AfterAll will run ONCE after all the tests have been run.

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach void setUp()
      BeforeEach runs before each test. In this case we are using it to ensure that the game state is reset before each test.

    • tearDown

      @AfterEach void tearDown()
      AfterEach runs after each test. We use this to reset the game state.

    • constructorTest

      @Test void constructorTest()
      Testing to make sure an object is created and that a bad file is detected. It might be better to separate these but since the file is read upon object initialization it makes sense to test it here.

    • readFileTest

      @Test void readFileTest()
      Can we read a file? Should be false for bad file names true for files that exist.

    • testGetAllWords

      @Test void testGetAllWords()
      Checking to see if the getting all words works.

    • checkChooseWord

      @Test void checkChooseWord()
      Making sure the word chosen is the word we expect. This also checks that remaining guesses works.

    • testDisplayGameState

      @Test void testDisplayGameState()
      Since this is testing print statement on a randomly chosen word... it's not a great test This SHOULD load a file with a single word, hard code a string with the proper output, then compare the hardcoded String to the generated String. I am kind of over it though. Realistically so long as the methods this requires are tested (which they are) than this one doesn't REALLY matter... that's my story anyway.

    • buildStateOut

      private String buildStateOut(String word)
      a helper method.
      Parameters:
      word - the current word being guessed.
      Returns:
      a String that SHOULD match the displayGameState method.

    • checkLose

      @Test void checkLose()
      Works through all the conditions that could lead to a loss.

    • checkWin

      @Test void checkWin()
      Force a win condition.

    • hintTest

      @Test void hintTest()
      Testing the hint system.

    • checkPlay

      @Test void checkPlay()
      Like gameState this really just runs the game. It should have some asserts. It might get some eventually..
